chat.content:
I will give you a Coq proof state, including both hypotheses and a specific goal and your need to prove it. Your response should be a singular code block of Coq proof starting with "```coq
", ending with "Qed.```", without any additional explanation or commentary. Follow to these guidelines:
Introduce variables using unique names to avoid any conflicts.
Keep each command distinct and separated, avoid concatenations like ';' or '[cmd|cmd]'.
Organize your proof with bullets like '-', '+', and '*' instead of braces ({, }). Shift to their double symbols like '--' and '++', when necessary.
Effectively use given premises, follow the syntax and structure demonstrated in the examples provided.

Example 1:

Hypotheses:
n, m: nat
IHn: m + n = n + m

Goal:
m + S n = S n + m

Your Response:
```coq
simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.
Qed.```

Example 2:
Hypotheses:

Goal:
forall n m : nat, m + n = n + m

Your Response:
```coq
intros n m. induction n.
- simpl. auto.
- simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.
Qed.```

Solve This Proof State:

Hypotheses:
p: nat
Hp: p <> 0
x: Z_Zp

Goal:
∸ Op ⊗ x = ∸ x

Premises:

Zp_ring_ring_lemma2 : forall (n : nat) (lH : list (Ring_polynom.PExpr Z * Ring_polynom.PExpr Z)) (l : list Z_Zp), Ring_polynom.interp_PElist Zp Op Zp_plus Zp_mult (fun x y => x ⊕ ∸ y) ∸ eq (gen_phiZ Zp Op Zp_plus Zp_mult ∸) id_phi_N (pow_N Op Zp_mult) l lH ->...-> Ring_polynom.PEeval Zp Op Zp_plus Zp_mult (fun x y => x ⊕ ∸ y) ∸ (gen_phiZ Zp Op Zp_plus Zp_mult ∸) id_phi_N (pow_N Op Zp_mult) l pe = Ring_polynom.Pphi_dev Zp Op Zp_plus Zp_mult (fun x y => x ⊕ ∸ y) ∸ 0%Z 1%Z Zeq_bool (gen_phiZ Zp Op Zp_plus Zp_mult ∸) get_signZ l npe

Zp_opp_plus : forall x y, ∸ (x ⊕ y) = ∸ x ⊕ ∸ y
Zp_opp_inj : forall x y, ∸ x = ∸ y -> x = y
Zp_minus : forall x, x ⊕ ∸ x = Zp
Zp_opp_inv : forall x, ∸ (∸ x) = x
Zp_mult_revert : forall x i : Z_Zp, i ⊗ x = Op -> is_gcd p (proj1_sig x) 1
Zp_is_ring = {| Radd_0_l := Zp_plus_zero; Radd_comm := Zp_plus_comm; Radd_assoc := Zp_plus_assoc; Rmul_1_l := Zp_mult_one; Rmul_comm := Zp_mult_comm; Rmul_assoc := Zp_mult_assoc; Rdistr_l := fun x y z : Z_Zp => Zp_mult_plus_distr_r z x y; Rsub_def := fun x y => eq_refl; Ropp_def := Zp_minus |} : ring_theory Zp Op Zp_plus Zp_mult (fun x y => x ⊕ ∸ y) ∸ eq
Zp_mult_one_r : forall x, x ⊗ Op = x
Zp_mult_one : forall x, Op ⊗ x = x
Zp_opp_plus_eq : forall x y z : Z_Zp, x ⊕ y = z < -> x = z ⊕ ∸ y
Zp_invertible = fun x => exists i : Z_Zp, i ⊗ x = Op : Z_Zp -> Prop
Zp_prime_invert : prime p -> forall x, x <> Zp -> {i : Z_Zp | i ⊗ x = Op}
Zp_mult_assoc : forall x y z : Z_Zp, x ⊗ (y ⊗ z) = x ⊗ y ⊗ z
Zp_mult_comm : forall x y, x ⊗ y = y ⊗ x
Zp_mult_plus_distr_l : forall x y z : Z_Zp, x ⊗ (y ⊕ z) = x ⊗ y ⊕ x ⊗ z
Zp_mult_plus_distr_r : forall x y z : Z_Zp, (y ⊕ z) ⊗ x = y ⊗ x ⊕ z ⊗ x
Zp_invertible_cancel_l : forall x y z : Z_Zp, Zp_invertible x -> x ⊗ y = x ⊗ z -> y = z
prime = fun p : nat => p <> 1 /\ (forall q : nat, divides q p -> q = 1 \/ q = p) : nat -> Prop Arguments prime _%nat_scope
Zp_mult_invert : forall x, is_gcd p (proj1_sig x) 1 -> {i : Z_Zp | i ⊗ x = Op}
Zp_mult_zero : forall x, Zp ⊗ x = Zp
div_full : forall q p : nat, {n : nat & {r : nat | q = n * p + r /\ (p <> 0 -> r < p)}}
Zp_one_invertible = ex_intro (fun i : Z_Zp => i ⊗ Op = Op) Op (let hyp_list := nil in let fv_list := nil in Zp_ring_ring_lemma1 ring_subst_niter fv_list hyp_list (Ring_polynom.PEmul Ring_polynom.PEI Ring_polynom.PEI) Ring_polynom.PEI I (eq_refl <: (let lmp := Ring_polynom.mk_monpol_list 0%Z 1%Z Z.add Z.mul Z.sub Z.opp Zeq_bool Z.quotrem hyp_list in Ring_polynom.Peq Zeq_bool (Ring_polynom.norm_subst 0%Z 1%Z Z.add Z.mul Z.sub Z.opp Zeq_bool Z.quotrem ring_subst_niter lmp (Ring_polynom.PEmul Ring_polynom.PEI Ring_polynom.PEI)) (Ring_polynom.norm_subst 0%Z 1%Z Z.add Z.mul Z.sub Z.opp Zeq_bool Z.quotrem ring_subst_niter lmp Ring_polynom...

rem_diag : forall p : nat, p <> 0 -> rem p p = 0
Nat.mul_cancel_r : forall n m p : nat, p <> 0 -> n * p = m * p < -> n = m
Nat.mul_cancel_l : forall n m p : nat, p <> 0 -> p * n = p * m < -> n = m
divides = fun n k : nat => exists p : nat, k = p * n : nat -> nat -> Prop Arguments divides (_ _)%nat_scope
Zp_zero = exist (fun x : nat => x < p) 0 ((fun lemma : 0 < p <-> (0 < Z.of_nat p)%Z => Morphisms.iff_flip_impl_subrelation (0 < p) (0 < Z.of_nat p)%Z lemma) (ZifyClasses.mkrel nat Z lt Z.of_nat Z.lt Nat2Z.inj_lt 0 0%Z eq_refl p (Z.of_nat p) eq_refl) (let Hp0 : Z.of_nat p <> 0%Z := ZifyClasses.rew_iff (p <> 0) (Z.of_nat p <> 0%Z) (ZifyClasses.not_morph (p = 0) (Z.of_nat p = 0%Z) (ZifyClasses.mkrel nat Z eq Z.of_nat eq (fun x y : nat => iff_sym (Nat2Z.inj_iff x y)) p (Z.of_nat p) eq_refl 0 0%Z eq_refl)) Hp in let cstr : (0 <= Z.of_nat p)%Z :=...
div_eq_0 : forall p : nat, p <> 0 -> forall n : nat, n < p -> div n p = 0
